title: Tools > Settings makes FF freeze and crash
content:
Hello there :D

Whenever I try to access the settings page in FF (to seach for a lost password for example), it freezes and crashes ... No other solution than to force restart ! Quite annoying ...

Any advices ?

Thanx :)
creator: hamlet.de.peerons

title: it does not load videos properly. it only loads home page.
content: it does not load videos properly. it only loads home page.
creator: chandra4

title: Search not working
content:
When I type a search query into the address bar and pres enter nothing happens, the little dot symbol just goes back and forth. Tried changing search engine, no change. MS Edge works OK.

I have just moved to Spain, could this be an issue, it never has in the past. Also Firefox updated to 91.0.2 just before I left UK.

Cheers Peter
creator: ipsleylodger2

title: letras superpuestas en algunos casos
content:
Hola, en ocasiones bastante pocas la verdad en según que webs o en el traductor que trae el navegador sale parte del texto superpuesto. He adjuntado 2 recortes para que vean a que me refiero. No se si es el navegador (no uso otro) o windows.

Ideas? Gracias, saludos a todos
creator: saritak

title: Restore
content: I create a new user. The default location folder is C and I changed the location folder selection to Download, I forgot to create a separate folder for the new user. so my data in the Download folder and Firefox's are mixed. Then I click delete the newly created user folder in About:Profiles. All my data in the Download folder is gone. how do i restore it? I can't find them in the deleted folder. Thank you!
creator: dung01677695951

title: How to increase the resolution on firefox inspect elements screenshot?
content: I do screenshots with firefox with Ctrl+Shift+S and you can click on the element you want to screenshot. But for some reason it does it in low resolution and my pictures are pixelated. How can I increase the quality or make it lossless?
creator: topcsmaster

title: macbook pro 2017 sound issues when playing youtube videos
content:
Hi all,

its now more then half a year where i got issues with playing videos within firefox. the videos is sometimes laggy and i have scratch/crackling sounds within the video.

if i try playing videos in other browsers i didnt got sound issues.

does anybody have the same issue?

thanks in advance. Cheers, Markus
creator: webmaster89

title: Microsoft OneDrive Image Downloads
content:
I have had this issue for a few months now where firefox will not download any image, video or pdf (I am assuming it's media related) from OneDrive on one of my computers. I thought maybe update would fix it but the problem exists. When I click on the download button, nothing happens - it's almost as if the buttons are disabled.

Chrome and firefox on my other devices works fine.
creator: sukhjit.321

title: is SYNC dependent on email address?  I use many emails!  LOST many logins / passwords.  Help.
content:
Finally used SYNC feature for the first time.

Am attempting to migrate out of FF (used windows system restore to bring back v88 - the 'new and fresh' design is defective, missing features I need and is unworkable for me.)

When I originally set up my FF account, I used a specific email for that - it is NOT the email i use for a majority of my browsing / website logins. (I regularly use about 50 different emails, each for a specific purpose).

After I synced FF and waterfox, I am now missing (about half) of my logins and passwords on BOTH browsers now.

it seems that firefox SYNC depends on using JUST ONE email address - for EVERYTHING?

seriously? Someone actually thought this was OK?

How do I fix this. Please help me sort this out. I seriously have no more patience to keep fixing stupid FF problems.

Thank you.
creator: tcb_reset

title: How to save images without the popup asking for location?
content:
Hi, I want to save images in two steps: "right-click ==> Save"

Under "Settings > Files and Applications" I checked the box "Save files to" so I don't have "Always ask you where to save files" but in the context menu, the only option is "save image as" and it always shows a popup that asks for the location where I want to store the image.

How can I get this done? it should be a feature easy to get since Firefox has evolved so much that we can customize almost anything nowadays... an extension by Firefox (or Recommended) that adds a button (a small one in the corner) to just download the image you're hovering over would be amazing but there is none atm.

Thank you for reading this, have a nice day :)
creator: rev3rs.webdev

title: Facebook won't load using FireFox Since "Upgrading" to Windows 11
content: When attempting to view Facebook using FireFox while running Windows 11, the Home Page hangs while waiting for data from "Static.XX.FBCDN.Net". I've tried clearing the browser cache without success. Did not experience this issue running Windows 10. Wondering if Microsoft is just not playing well with others. Any thoughts/Fixes/Workarounds welcome. Note: Do not experience the problem when using Chrome.
creator: mandeltort

title: Facebook does not load correctly in mozilla firefox/ problema con facebook no carga completamente
content:
Hello, for almost 1 month I have problems navigating on facebook from mozilla firefox from pc, 90% of the time it does not load me completely or it loads me and I enter another page or profile and everything does not load, I already cleared cache cookies and now uninstall 2 times and follow that problem, only in firefox the other browsers work correctly, I already scan my pc with the antivirus and everything is correct, firefox is not blocked in my firewall, any solution?

Hola, desde hace casi 1 mes tengo problemas navegando en facebook desde mozilla firefox desde pc, el 90% de las veces no me carga por completo o me carga y entro en otra página o perfil y no se carga todo, ya borré caché cookies y ahora desinstalo 2 veces y sigue ese problema, solo en firefox los otros navegadores funcionan correctamente, ya escaneo mi pc con el antivirus y todo es correcto, firefox no esta bloqueado en mi firewall, alguna solución?
creator: arokboom

title: FireFox Freaking Far Out
content:
Firefox has started to do strange things. I have security set to medium, as I have had it for several years now. All of a sudden, when I go to some sites (~70% of the time), it tells me that it cannot connect to a secure site, and do I want connect to the “HTTP: site or not. This happens with little known sites like https://www.usps.gov, https:/www.amazon.com, and, oh yes, https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/.

Also EVERY time I try and go to https://www.Google.com, I get a message that says,

“Secure Connection Failed An error occurred during a connection to www.google.com. PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.”

Also, whenever I go from a page to another in a different tab, or separately, it takes between 15-20 seconds up to a couple of MINUTES.

I have to use Microsoft’s horrible (to ME) EDGE program, which does all of the above WITHOUT PROBLEMS, and almost instantly! I have removed Firefox (ALWAYS the latest version) several times, and have even edited the registry to rid it of any Mozilla remnants. Install a new copy. SAME THING even without loading logins or bookmarks!

PLEEEEEZE help! I have been a Firefox user since 1984, when it was introduced!
creator: Pandreasen

title: How to disable "tab badges"? For example, Yahoo! Mail's "new mail" red dot tab badge?
content:
These are extremely obnoxious, ruin my productivity and lower my quality of life. There must be a way to disable these? (of course Yahoo! doesn't offer one because it wants to make me click the tab and see their banners).

Image attached.
creator: voltron8888

title: Downloading files - directly attach file to blank email on email client?
content:
Hi all. I am using Windows 10 OS and Microsoft Outlook for emails.

When presented with the dialog box for downloading/saving a file, can Firefox directly attach the downloaded file to a blank email using my email client?

I have done a one-line batch file (which seems to work with "open with") that has the command:

"C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\root\Office16\outlook.exe" /a %1

and it seems to work, but is there an official or quicker solution? one that doesn't have to involve browsing for the batch file (having to type * or *.* to not show only .exe/.com files) with the "open with" option?

Alternatively is there a right-click context menu with a "send to" or "email to" that opens the email client and a blank email with the downloaded file already attached? (Or possibly there is a mailto or sendto command that can be selected in "open with"?)

Thank you.
creator: nicolaschen
